title: How Monsters Spawn in R.E.P.O. (Guide and Code deep dive)

tasks.task: Navigate through game levels and manage monster spawns.
subtasks: Understand the three levels of entities in the game.

Recognize specific entities in each level (Peeper, Shadowchild, 4 Gnomes, Apex Predator, Spewer, Rugrat, Animal, Upscream, Hidden, Chef, Bowtie, Mentalist, Three Bangers, Headman, Robe, Huntsman, Reaper, Clown, Trudge).
Realize the probability of each entity type spawning (equal chance per level).
Note the exception where 4.6656% of level 3 slots can be replaced by lower-level sets.
Determine the number of each lower-level entity set that can replace a level 3 entity.
Understand the spawning mechanics for game levels 1-2, 3-5, 6-8, 9-10, and 11+.
Observe the monster idle times on each level (reducing from 2-3 minutes on level 1 to 0 seconds on level 11).
Learn about the despawn timer for entities, starting at 4-5 minutes and decreasing over time.
Note the effect of player kills on despawn timers (multiplied by 3 for the first 10 minutes).
Understand the final extraction process and the increased aggression of monsters afterward.
Consider strategic placement to force monsters to despawn.
Plan for the dangerous final extraction phase.

tasks.task: Manage the timing and strategy for monster encounters and entity despawn.
subtasks: Adapt movement and positioning based on entity spawn timing and idle times.
Use distant areas to disrupt entity spawn positions and encourage despawn.
Practice timed respawns to exploit delayed monster respawning (within first 10 minutes).
Adjust strategies based on the level's remaining time and entity timers.

tasks.task: Use the knowledge of entity behavior to outmaneuver them during gameplay.
subtasks: Anticipate monster movement patterns after the final extraction.
Plan retreat routes and safe rooms considering monster patrol paths.
Implement a rotation of players for final extraction to manage risk.
